cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (145 km) SW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southeast and central Gulf of Mexico, then expected to turn north and make landfall along the Louisiana coast before curving northeast inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast roughly between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River (near Metropolitan New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA; Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border (tropical-storm watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (hurricane warning); east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the MS/AL border (storm-surge warning); additional tropical-storm warnings west of Intracoastal City LA to Cameron and from Pearl River to MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana through coastal Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.wind: None expected within next 5 days; only remnant low-level gusts (<34 kt) possible late next week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain to New England around 2–3 Sep, but widespread 4-inch totals are not anticipated.
